CPOP 0.0.18

Prediction function for CPOP

predict_cpop.Rd

Prediction function for CPOP

predict_cpop(cpop_result, newz, s = "lambda.min", model_number = 1L,
  tibble = FALSE)

Arguments

cpop_result

cpop_model result
newz

New data
s

CV-Lasso lambda
model_number

1 or 2 or "both"
tibble

Logical

Value

A vector

Examples

set.seed(1)
n = 1000
p = 10
x1 = matrix(rnorm(n * p, mean = 0, sd = 1), nrow = n, ncol = p)
x2 = x1 + 0.1
colnames(x1) = colnames(x2) = paste0("X", 1:p)
k = 2
beta = c(rep(1, k), rep(0, p - k))
expit = function(x) 1/(1+exp(-x))
y1 = rbinom(n, 1, prob = expit(x1 %*% beta))
y2 = rbinom(n, 1, prob = expit(x2 %*% beta))
z1 = pairwise_col_diff(x1)
z2 = pairwise_col_diff(x2)
w = compute_weights(z1, z2)
nIter = 20
cpop_result = cpop_model(z1, z2, y1, y2, w, nIter = 20, alpha = 1, s = "lambda.min")
#> Fitting CPOP model using alpha = 1
#> 
#>  0  1 
#> 13 32 
#> CPOP1 - Step: 01: Number of selected features: 0 out of 45
#> CPOP1 - Step: 02: Number of selected features: 14 out of 45
#> CPOP1 - Step: 03: Number of selected features: 23 out of 45
#> CPOP1 - Step: 04: Number of selected features: 34 out of 45
#> CPOP1 - Step: 05: Number of selected features: 34 out of 45
#> CPOP1 - Step: 06: Number of selected features: 34 out of 45
#> CPOP1 - Step: 07: Number of selected features: 34 out of 45
#> CPOP1 - Step: 08: Number of selected features: 34 out of 45
#> CPOP1 - Step: 09: Number of selected features: 34 out of 45
#> CPOP1 - Step: 10: Number of selected features: 34 out of 45
#> CPOP1 - Step: 11: Number of selected features: 34 out of 45
#> CPOP1 - Step: 12: Number of selected features: 34 out of 45
#> CPOP1 - Step: 13: Number of selected features: 34 out of 45
#> CPOP1 - Step: 14: Number of selected features: 34 out of 45
#> CPOP1 - Step: 15: Number of selected features: 34 out of 45
#> CPOP1 - Step: 16: Number of selected features: 34 out of 45
#> CPOP1 - Step: 17: Number of selected features: 34 out of 45
#> CPOP1 - Step: 18: Number of selected features: 34 out of 45
#> CPOP1 - Step: 19: Number of selected features: 34 out of 45
#> CPOP1 - Step: 20: Number of selected features: 34 out of 45
#> 50 features was not reached. 
#> CPOP2 - Sign: Step 01: Number of leftover features: 29 out of 34

#>

#>   -1  0 0 0

head(predict_cpop(cpop_result, newz = z1, model_number = 1))
#>      cpop_model1
#> [1,]   1.7455061
#> [2,]   1.2567662
#> [3,]  -0.7942998
#> [4,]   0.7184437
#> [5,]   0.7585224
#> [6,]  -2.1528420
head(predict_cpop(cpop_result, newz = z1, model_number = "both", tibble = TRUE))
#> # A tibble: 6 x 3
#>   samples cpop_model1 cpop_model2

#> 5 5             0.759       0.739

head(predict_cpop(cpop_result, newz = z1, model_number = "avg", tibble = TRUE))
